newsitem.title: LEBANON: Solidere B up on Beirut Stock Exchange.
newsitem.headline: Solidere B up on Beirut Stock Exchange.

text.p: Solidere B shares rose slightly on Thursday on the Beirut Stock Exchange for the first time in nine days.

The B shares rose to $10.875 from $10.75 while Solidere A closed at Wednesday's $10.375. Total Solidere turnover fell to 84,530 shares from 121,745 as demand for A shares fell sharply at Thursday's second fixing.
Of the nine shares in seven companies listed on the exchange, two rose, one fell, three were unchanged and three were untraded.
The BLOM stock index rose 0.5 percent to 911.16 and the LISPI rose 0.19 percent to 84.46.
Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce and Banque Audi were steady at $13.625 and $19.125 respectively. The LIBX bank index held steady at 118.48.
Industrial pipemaker Eternit rose for the second successive day on heavy demand, reaching $1.875 from Wednesday's $1.8125. Turnover rose to 4,750 shares from 2,000.
Ciments Libanais fell back to $1.1875 after a brief rise on Wednesday to $1.2187. Some 2,000 shares changed hands.
There was no trade in the two other listed firms: Ciments Blancs and Uniceramic.
Total BSE turnover was 111,032 shares for a value of $1,239,403 against 152,629 shares for a value of $1,741,091.
